## 1. Rewrite Bayes' Law when the two events are independent. How do you interpret this?

$P(A|B) = \frac{P(B|A)P(A)}{P(B)}$

* $P(A|B) =P(A)$
* $P(B|A) =P(B)$

$P(A|B) = \frac{P(B) \cdot P(A)}{P(B)} = P(A)$

The occurance of A does not impact the occurance of B.
